sentences: Keppi on pikem ja jäik ese, mida kasutatakse toetuseks või juhtimiseks.
Vanur võttis oma kepi käte vahele.
context: The word 'keppi' is part of the Estonian declension system - it's the illative singular form of 'kepp'. In English, this translates to 'into a stick', 'into a cane', or 'into a staff'. The word refers to a long, rigid object that serves as support or guidance. While 'kepp' (the nominative form) means 'stick', 'keppi' specifically indicates motion into something (illative case). In the example sentence 'Haige kasutab käimisel keppi', it shows someone using this type of walking aid.
